Know how your elected officials have voted on key civil liberties issues. And then know when and how to cast your ballot in Iowa.
Be an Informed Voter

Dear ##SM_RULE_360 Email Salutation##,

Informed voters are crucial to our democracy. That's why we've put together two invaluable resources for voters in Iowa.

The 2018 Iowa Legislative Report and Civil Liberties Scorecard takes a look at how our national and state representatives and senators voted on key civil liberties issues and then scores them accordingly. It's a useful tool for finding out where your elected officials stand on issues like free speech, government transparency, immigration, abortion, voting rights, criminal justice reform, and more.

Read the 2018 Iowa Legislative Report and Civil Liberties Scorecard.

With changes in Iowa voting laws, we've also updated our online and printed voting rights information. You'll get the details on who is eligible to vote (including those with a felony conviction in their background), voter registration basics, voting early, voting on Election Day, the rundown on voter ID, and what to do if you have problems at the polls.

Know your voting rights in Iowa and get the printer-friendly voting rights flyer.

Thanks for your interest and advocacy,

Daniel Zeno
Policy Director, ACLU of Iowa
